ygData.subject: Re: Optional locations
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes I have finished it.  No tinkering info though - you end up with a free Elemental Grimoire (great quest for Magician s - will save you 11pp+). However, the
ygData.messageBody:
Yes I have finished it. No tinkering info though - you end up with a free
Elemental Grimoire (great quest for Magician's - will save you 11pp+).
However, the wording is incorrect in the quest and might be a little
confusing to some. Tergon asks you to bring back Toko Binlittle's
spellbook (the renegade mage-turned-pirate). Toko drops a Tier'dal head
(casting Identify on it reveals "a cowardly dark elf head"). Perhaps the
head is hollowed out and he stores is scrolls in it <g>. Anyways, take
that head back to Tergon and he will give you the Grimoire + the usual
exp/faction bonus.

As a side note, I finished this quest without talking to the gnome in
Crushbone - perhaps he might have more info on this tinkered "shotgun". I
also completed this quest quite some time ago and it may have been
changed.

Quasinom de Plume
{Mith Marr Server}


--- Tony Buser <gr0k@...> wrote:
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Zach Heaven <zheaven@...>
> To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, October 05, 1999 11:45 AM
> Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Optional locations
> > First I want someone to tell me what the gnome in the back of
> crushbone in
> the
> > pit is for? I was there when I was in my teens, but have not returned
> to
> see
> > what he did.
>
> The gnome in crushbone is actually part of the Tergon's Spellbook quest
> which has recently been fixed since Bugglepup the gnome now spawns in
> steamfont. When you talk to Tergon in ak'anon he says to retrieve a
> metal
> pellet that he shot Bugglepup with and lost. Well once you return it to
> him
> he tells you to search out his brother in Freeport and give him a letter
> that tells him to give you the spellbook. So you goto freeport and
> learn
> that he was captured by the orcs. So you take the letter to him in
> crushbone and he tells you the oracle in the castle took the book. Kill
> the
> oracle, return the book and tergon sends you to oot to kill a renegade
> gnome
> thats taken up with the pirates of gunthark. Thats as far as I've
> gotten
> with the quest.
>
> I was really hopeing it would yield tinkering info because Tergon says
> he
> shot bugglepup with one of his contraptions. (a tinker made shotgun of
> some
> sort??) :) Anyone ever finish all of Tergon's quests to the end?
>
> ---
> gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
> "Linux... find out what you've been missing while
> you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld
>
